review:
A fast paced asteroids-style game where players and AI shoot rockets, missiles, and bombs at each other, with short lived shields to deflect opponents shots. The camera is incredibly spastic, constantly zooming in and out of the action, especially when there's only two players remaining. The game is very obviously a local multiplayer game. Only purchase it if you have friends to play with, either locally or through remote play. The game is not very deep - after 2 or 3 plays you understand everything the game has to offer, and there are only a few maps and game mode types. Even with AI the game only supports up to 4 players.

It feels like a Mario Party minigame turned into a full concept. The music is pretty good, everything else is just sort of passable. Controls are easy to pick up but difficult to master in any way by design - the game is meant to feel spastic and out of control constantly. If you have friends that would enjoy it, you'll probably get a few nights of fun out of it, which is pretty good for seven bucks. Otherwise, pass on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1582483394}
review:
Играешь в игры в гордом одиночестве? Проходи мимо.

Я только запустил игру, и чуть не сдох от удовольствия, встретив стартовый экран и шикарный саундтрек. Такой же кайф был, рассматривая главное меню.
Сама картинка геймплея тоже выше всяких похвал...

Вот только core-механика меня расстроила вдребезги. Ровно то же самое, 1 в 1, я испытал, играя в Hyperdrive Massacre - ты просто запускаешь матч, пытаешься сделать хоть что-то против AI - и сосёшь. Как я не извивался, как не прицеливался и какие кнопки не нажимал - ни бомбы, ни мины, ни ракеты не смогли мне подсобить в победе над ботом хотя бы единожды. Поражение за поражением, каждый раз. Даже зайдя в How to Play, легче не стало. Враг тупо постоянно находится в моём ненавистном в играх режиме турели - прицел всегда на игроке, какие бы чудеса ловкости ты не проявлял.

Дизайнеру, художникам, музыканту (Ben Lam), и всем прочим, что отвечали за картинку и звук - нижайший поклон.

Тому, кто отвечал за саму стартовую идею и реализацию - "Ты сам засрал весь проект, изначально придумывая такие дурацкие условия. Поздравляю".

Возможно, я бы остался в полном восторге вообще, если бы с самого начала разделил удовольствие геймплея с друзьями, но запускать пока что мне приходилось только соло - а значит, меня встречал только мерзкий, ублюдский "Совершенный искусственный интеллект". Онлайн мультиплеера нет вообще - а значит, и шансов покайфовать и сменить палец вниз на вверх.

review:
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is a party game where you and your friend try to blow each other up. Since there is no story we are jumping straight to graphics.

Graphics:

The art style of ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is a bright neon look that enjoy. I absolutely adore the neon look and love pretty much everything that is of the same art style, it's bright and vibrant and just pleasant to look at and people who know me can attest that I absolutely love it, so that is something that I have to give huge props to.

Audio:

The soundtrack is also really good. It has some nice techno-ish music and it's does go along with the game well and provides for some good background noise.

Gameplay: 

You and a couple of your friends fly around with rockets and try to blow each other up. It's fun enough, but sadly there's many flaws in this game that make me give this a negative review. Don't get me wrong, the gameplay is fun and with a couple of friends it's a blast, but sadly since the game is local co-op only, there's not much play value here.

You need to have a full party for this game to be truly fun, but even then it won't last long, maybe an hour of fun before you and your friends want to jump into something else. There's no doubt that with Online co-op this game would be much more fun. 

Verdict:

ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is a fun game, but sadly since there's no online co-op, I don't recommend buying this game, not to mention there's many other party games that allow full local co op and also online co op that are much better. 

Final Rating:
5/10

Pros:
+ Vibrant graphics
+ Cool soundtrack 
+ Fun gameplay
 
Cons:
- Gameplay does get stale after a while
- No online

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1538940724}
review:
Tags: Combat Arena & Smashbroesque
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Couchplay combat using clumsy Lunar Lander design elements and a ton of neon and some dubstep. Camera issues. 

Short lived and ill conceived. You can fight the controls to try to manage momentum and face your foe. You attack using a spread of rocket, which itself seems to only be triggered after an invisible timer finishes.

So you are constantly holding fire, and spurting out attack rockets more or less randomly, while the camera zooms in and out aggressively with the dubstep and the lights blaring.

The controls and camera behavior was marginally better for the solo singleplayer mode, and I even thought for a second that they might have had a shot at making an actual lunar lander remake viable, but unfortunately that mode is also rather empty and unengaging and serves as little more than a practice mode.

Conclusion: This is arguably worse than Starwhal even due to the unadressed design issues. The brute forced art direction and mood will immediately grate some, while wearing off quickly for others as it becomes increasingly clear that the play experience is just uncomfortable for everyone.

review:
[b]ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS[/b] to specyficzna, lecz w gruncie rzeczy przyjemna gra, którą można traktować jako odskocznia od innych bardziej wymagających tytułów – taki przyjemny, chwilowy odskok do czegoś innego.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]
Nie ma co za bardzo opisywać gdyż jest to po prostu przyjemna, prosta (w teorii) gra, w której można się wyszaleć, [b]walcząc rakietą z innymi rakietami, strzelającymi rakietami[/b] – wiem jak to brzmi, ale uwierzcie mi jest w tym głębszy sens xD

Tak więc cały koncept / schemat gry jest wypisany powyżej, to typowa gra rywalizacji, wygrywa osoba która pozostanie najdłużej przy życiu – prosta ale i zarazem wciągająca gra dla małego grona znajomych.

[b]Sterowanie[/b], nie należy do najprostszych to trzeba przyznać, jednakże po pewnym czasie można opanować tajniki sterowania nasza rakietą.

[b]Grafika[/b], jak i muzyka w grze jest dobra, przyjemna w odbiorze, jak na tego typu produkcie (niskobudżetową) nie ma co wymagać – wszystko jest ok.

[b]Przeciwnik komputerowy[/b], jest trudny, zwłaszcza kiedy gramy jeden na jednego możemy się spodziewać solidnego lania – zachęcam by grać ze znajomymi, gra się przyjemniej.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS to mała, przyjemna gra, odskocznia od bardziej zajmujących tytułów, dająca chwile odetchnięcia, szybki zastrzyk zabawy – tytuł często występuje w promocji wiec można go nabyć za naprawdę grosze.

Polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141468229', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1513977218}
review:
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is a game with the simple concept of being control of a small rocket with the idea being that you have to eliminate up to 3 other rockets (PvP or PvC) using Missles, Mines, and Bombs. Sounds simple, but the way the game presents itself, and how it makes use of what it has it what makes it such a blast to pIay!

The game's enviroments (Maps) consist of simple neon colored shapes that can be used as cover from incoming attacks from enemy rockets. There aren't many maps in the game at the moment but the maps that are currently availible still manage to offer a grand time with friends

The game's graphics consist of the use of simple neon colors that can be seen in the enviroment as mentioned, but dispite being simple the game still manages to look amazing even though there are no use of any background images. The game allows you to use your rockets exaust trails in order to paint the enviroment, even though you may be left with scribbles because of the fact that you'll be dogfighting with other players, but the game offers a Zen mode that lets fly around, drawing in the enviroment, while listening to the game's music.

Speaking of the music. It consists of Dubstep that DEMANDS your attention, even though there isn't much of it (The Soundtrack only consists of nine songs, but they're all good)

lastly, the game's weapons (Missles, Mines, and Bombs) work like you may expect them to in other dogfighting games (Missles can be shot directly towards an enemy rocket and is the primary weapon you will be using, Mines are bombs that can be dropped behind you to stop any Rockets tailing you, and Bombs can be dropped and blow up any enemy rockets from below.) But a quick thing to note on the weapons is that all of them have the secondary ability to be fired in a barrage attack (which is what I call them at least) which fires mutilple rounds from the gun you're using, this can be done by pressing and holding the fire button for that weapon.

In the end, the game is really simple in design but it offers a fun and challenging experience for those who decide to get this game. 

9/10

review: I am deeply sadden by this game, because I have never seen such a great potential for a game to be something amazing that was never achieved. Rockets does something that few other games do, it takes a concept, simplifies it, and then perfects it. When you play this game, you find yourself in one of the best feeling, looking, and joy filling games you will ever play, so why is it bad? This game may have some of the best combat you will ever experience, but you can do nothing with it. Imagine Rockets like an towering skyscraper, it is jaw dropping, beautiful, and unbreakable. So what is the problem with the building? Well the thing is empty! There is no furniture, no colors, no substance. They have laid the ground work for one of the biggest games we could ever see, but they have left their foundation completely empty. There is two game modes, (Both of which are just the basic battle with different health systems.) one AI, four maps, and thats really it, where as what the game doesn't have is more customization, more single player ability, and ONLINE! Why would you not give this game online, that just doesn't make sense! I hate to see such an amazing game go down in history as just another indie game, just because it didn't give people enough to talk about, but here it is, and here is will stay. The perfect recipe for something amazing that they just didn't take the time to make into a dish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969510304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1482130728}
review:
Me and my crew play a 'lot' of 4 player couch games. I end up buying just about every one that comes out that seems worth playing. But whenever we sit down for a session, if ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS comes up in the rotation it basically stays up for the rest of the night. 

It isn't the deepest, most graphically impressive, or most content-rich game. But the fundamental gameplay the devs have hit upon is just 'so good' it outshines any shortcomings. The flight and shooting/blocking mechanics just feel excellent and tense as hell. They have added maps/modes since release, which is welcome and appreciated, but even back when this was just one map and 4 players it was still well worth the price. It's probably best with 2 players, because that's how the (absolutely amazing) dynamic camera functions best, but I've found it totally enjoyable with 4 and that's how I usually end up playing it. 

If you're in a situation where you can get 2-4 people in the same room, and you like playing stuff like Lethal League/Samurai Gunn/Towerfall/etc... this is a top tier one of those IMO.

review:
[h1]買ってはいけません。[/h1]

ゲームの面白さについてはPVや、他のレビューを見ればわかると思いますが、
かなり面白いゲームです。(友達がいれば)
このゲームの問題は[u]"詐欺"[/u]です。

サ！

ギ！

まず、公式のニュースがオカシイのです。
公式によると2015/05/02に正式リリースなのですが、
メインプレイのメニューに堂々と「soon!」と書いてあり、
遊べないモードが有ります。
こう書くと　いつかは出るんでしょ？　と思いたくなります。
残念です。
公式ニュースでは最新バージョンが6なのですが、実際にはバージョン8です。
これはもうニュースをわざと更新していないと見るしかありません。
公式ブログも正式リリース以降全く更新なし。
こんな態度で本当に全機能を実装するんですかねぇ...

さらには過去のバージョンではワークショップがあり、ゲームで遊べるマップが
1種類しかないという弱点も克服していたのですが、何を考えたのか
最新バージョンにはModを読み込んで遊ぶモードが丁寧に削除されています。

これでも欲しい方は買ってから1時間ほど遊び、
マップの乏しさにがっかりして返金してください。
返品できない3、4時間遊んだあたりで100人中60人は飽きてくるでしょう。

あるいは友達と大いに盛り上がり、あのレビューが詐欺じゃねーか！！と
どうぞ罵ってください。

review:
I was initially drawn to this by just how simple yet bizarre the premise is. the idea of flying a rocket, that fires rockets at rockets while also roughly obeying rocket handling physics sounded like all of my jam. thankfully, after playing this gameafter it fully released, the game lives up to expectations.

The game has an interesting sort of light humour about it and runs very smoothly on my system, even in 4K, its graphics are simple but clean and stylised and its sound is great. but all of this would be worthless were the gameplay not there to support it.

I can gladly report that the gameplay on this titles is superb. firing rockets is tricky but getting a hit is satisfying, simply flying around requires and easy-to-learn-hard-to-master kind of skill and just how this game handles means that potential groups of up to four could have endless fun with this game. though that said, one person alone can easily find great enjoyment with this title, simply flying around in zen mode and relaxing or playing against some challenging AI.

put bluntly, the amount of skill required in this game is refreshing and its gameplay and difficulty curve will suit casual and dedicated players alike.

Finally, this game has some of the best controller support I've seen, with support for dualshock 3 and 4 controllers without ever needing any aftermarket software, naturally, Xbox support is baked in too.

all told, this is a really great game and i'm glad i played it.

review:
I think I found my new favorite local multiplayer game! 

Do remember exactly what you're buying when you're buying this though - it's local co-op, so you NEED other people to play besides you to fully enjoy the game. Sure, the single player will take up some time (the AI is challenging), but you'll ultimately need people to play with (and scream at?).

As for the game, I adore the minimalistic gameplay and aesthetics - it's oddly charming! Something which I really found added to the game's challenge is the ship movement controls - it's fluid yet rather hard to aim your ship. This could've easily made or broken the game, and it definitely did the former.

If I have to criticize something, it'd be the inclusion of the zen mode, and lack of variety in game modes. I can't really fathom any situation where I'd play in the Zen mode and just fly around randomly with people, and not do anything. And yes, it'd be super cool to get more game modes, and an online multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1442973741}
review:
This is a crazy fun game featuring up to 4 Rockets shooting Missiles, Dropping bombs, and laying Mines in order to knock out the opponents 3 Bubbles(3 by default), and if you have less than the max Bubbles at the time, hitting the enemies will give you one. You can also just ram their Bubbles with your Rocket, but it's risky since at that point freaking blank range, they're practically guaranteed to hit you unless you perfectly time your Shield, which makes you invulnerable for a couple seconds.

The game is very fast pace, colorful, with great music. Music that actually makes me want to purchase its soundtrack, which is saying something since it's $8. There's also a Tug-O-War mode, were, you need to hit the other team to move the counter towards your side 3 blips, and hold it for a small-ish time, but them hitting you forces the blips towards them. And then there's Zen Mode, where you just fly around and draw pretty pictures with your Rockets Color Trail.

If you've ever seen or played Mario Carts battle mode with the 3 Balloons, the Bubbles mode is like that.

The only downside I see is that the keyboard controls greatly limit your potential, and is nowhere near as fun as it is with a Controller.

I definitely recommend this game to anyone who was some fast pace arcade fun.

review:
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is hands down the most entertaining way to get carpal tunnel playing couch co-op. It has beautiful aesthetics and is quite enjoyable to play with a friend, against the AI, or even in the more pacifist Zen mode flying around and making art with rocket trails. The combat is simple, intuitive, and amazing, with three projectiles and a dash maneuver which allow for diverse gameplay. You can shoot missles, leave nasty mines, and drop bombs to cause beautiful, beautiful havoc. I'm not kidding. It's quite beautiful watching the brightly colored projectiles and stages blossom with bright, cheerful explosions as your enemies spin, hit by your barrage of missles and bombs or blasted by a mine. There is a lot of potential for skill, but even beginners can play without too much barrier.

Pros:
Fun gameplay
Beautiful (minimalist) graphics
Great game modes
Couch versus, co-op vs bots, and Zen mode

Cons:
High risk of intense button mashing, play at your own risk.
No online multiplayer (and, given the intense speed of matches, it makes sense, though it would be amazing if it existed)
Basically requires a controller- playable on keyboard and mouse, but much less fun.

I highly recommend this game if you have a friend nearby or just want to relax and unwind against a bot or in Zen mode.

review:
I wanted to like this game, but I experienced some serious motion sickness within the first minute or so of playing. What happens is, whenever you and your enemy get close to each other (which happens regularly), the camera does a quick extreme closeup, and then when you move away from each other very shortly after, the camera does a quick zoom out. Over and over. 

It was so bad that when I went into the menus to look for visual settings that would reduce it - because surely something like that would exist in a game that does this - I was still getting sick from scrolling through the menus. I can't be sure, but I think they jolt slightly as you move between them. And there is no option to reduce the nausea.

Sorry guys.

review:
Ill be honest, I bought this game with the intent to try it out and then return it. What i experienced when i booted up that first game instantly changed that. This is a phenominally simple game, but it is SO MUCH FUN.

[list] [u]Pros:[/u]

[*]Simplistic and beautiful.
[*]Easy to grasp controls.
[*]Amazing game for couch co-op or multiplayer.
[*]Intense Dogfights. Like Intense!

 [u]Cons:[/u]

review:
Эта игра самая дешевая что есть у меня в стиме но зато самая КРУТАЯ из всех
 ---Плюсы---
-Саундтрек. Это самое великое что есть здесь и самое главное и состовляет примерно 50% игры
-Геймплей. Здесь тоже замечательный и состоит на 25% от всей игры 
-Ну и самое интерестное это стиль игры он весь красочный
 ---Минусы---
-Это ее сложность. В самой игре очень сложно играть на клавиатуре а на геймпаде намного проще после пары часов можно смело говорить что вы профи. 
-Краски. Цвета этой игры достаточно сильно влиют на глаза и поэтому больше 3 раундов(в день) играть не хочется 
-Геймлей(да да он в обоих сторонах). В этой игре особого смысла нет и поэтому как я уже говорил больше 3 раундов(в день) не поиграешь дальше немного скучно.
 ---------ВЫВОД---------
Игра достойна своей цены. Большинство в этой игре занимает саундтрек от которого зависит геймплей. И если вы не умеете играть с геймпада то это идеальная игра чтобы научится играть с него.
Также эта игра спасает от пригараний в области 5 точки так что очень советую всем не уравновешаным.
----------ВЫВОД2---------
Цена 5\10
Саундрек 10\10
Геймлей 7\10
Игра 9\10

review:
Ich bin seit der Beta (oder Alpha?) ein großer Fan von Rockets³ ! 

Wolltet ihr schon immer ein Sci-fi Spiel haben, wo man rundenbasiert den Gegner oder Freund taktisch oder diplomatisch in die Ecke zwängt und auf seine Kapitulation wartet? Wenn ja, seid ihr hier eher falsch!

Das Spiel ist wie eine Runde Monopoly oder Risiko mit Freunden. Dabei lacht ihr eure Freunde aus, wenn ihr am gewinnen seid und dadurch jeder andere in den Rage-Modus kommt (over90000!!!!), sprich; sehr gut! 

ZUM SPIEL
Vorweg; ich habe ehrlicherweise deutlich weniger als zwei Euro gezahlt für das Spiel, da ich wie gesagt schon für die Beta (s.o.) in das Team und das Spiel investiert habe. Dafür kommen immer wieder neue Features raus und es wird immer sehr schön fleißig gearbeitet am Spiel, um einer der lustigsten Partyspiele zu entwickeln, dass

- Jeder weniger als in einer Minute versteht
 (Da die Steuerung sehr leicht, aber dennoch einen spritze Schwammigkeit besitzt)
- sehr gute Partymusik besitzt
 (ähnlich wie Hotline Miami 2, die sich auch auf das Spielfluss reagiert)
- viele Spielmodus
 (Bis zu 4 Raketen können sich im Team oder alle gegen alle in ein schnellen Spiel oder Turnieren oder anderen Modi)

Fazit -> s.o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075280055', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1687630190}
review:
EDIT :   

Changed from negative to positive on 3/1/2015.  Dev replied.   The devs are listening and are working on the game in a positive way, so im sure that it is headed in a good direction.  The regular game is still a thumbs down, for now, but most of my issues with it have been addressed in the beta version.  

The beta version is playable for me with bloom turned off but imo its just not the same without it.
Changes included in beta version detailed at the bottom. 

.............................................................................................................................................................
RECCOMENDATION :  YES : 

I would wholeheartedly reccommend this game a few months ago, but not anymore.   I am writing this review with the hopes of getting the devs attentions, youve made an amazing game and I want to point out some things so that i can play it again.  I completely reccommend this game at 5$, but only after below said issues are fixed.   Review will be updated as changes happen.     

Sound: 8/10
Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Bloom: 2/10
Controls: 6/10
OVERALL: 6/10 for now

...............................................................................................................................................................

GAMEPLAY :  


Rocketsx3 is a great PvP multiplayer game. Can be played against bots as well.  You can play upto 4 player but the experience is best with 2. You could play 4 on a TV pretty well.   

You control a ship and you have 3 weapons.  Mines, missiles, and  bombs.  Each of these attacks can be fired one at a time, or charged and released to dish out a devastating barrage of your weapon of choice.    

Mines launch behind you and detonate in an area after a while.  Missiles launch directly in front of you and shoot forward.     Bombs are like tiny missiles but have no thrust, so they fall off from the side of your rocket.
You get a sheild that also functions as a speed boost, allowing you to block attacks or get out of a tight situation.  

First to 3 hits in a row wins! You can hit yourself and that deducts from your score.   
Controlling your ship may be hard at first but youll get the hang of it.  


Gameplay is fast, solid, and fluid.  Matches are usually short but may last longer. And boy are those longer matches tense.   Dodging missiles, falling for mine traps, using bombs to block your escape, a well timed charge attack to get two hits in a row or that moment when you engage eachother in a tense spiral of death.     

Graphics are great, a very beautiful and neon art style, and the announcer ingame is great. A female, robotic assistant type voice.  The AI is amazing and WILL beat you many times. 


................................................................................................................................................................


COMPLAINTS : 
 
I used to love this game. I played it  everyday with a good friend of mine. Both of us have stopped playing this game now due to changes made to it over successive updates that has left the game unplayable for us.  These reasons are :  

1) WAY too bright. The brightness of the ship burner and particles, as well as environment objects and trails was multiplied by 20.   There should be a slider for this.  I miss the darkened out trails that the game had in the beginning, the bright trails before the christmas update were fine too, but it became WAY too sparkly after that. no reason that this cant be optional.   

2) Difficult to fight in tight spaces now.  Due to the changes to particles and brightness, when you clash with eachother in tight corners or against walls, you cant tell what is going on.   

3) Unncessary clutter added.  Your health is depicted by 3 balls around your ship. I feel that this adds unncessary clutter to the game and takes away from your focus.  I prefer the healthbar at the top. No reason why this cant be an option.  

4) Screen size  : I play this game on my 21 inch 1980x1080 desktop, where the game is just about playable in its current state.   On my  1366x768 laptop though, i cant see anything anymore.    

5) The background was darkened out to try and fix the visibility issue i reckon,  and it looks plain terrible.  

6) The pulsating rocket trail. Please no.    

7) The last life slowdown. Let this be an option. It takes away from the fast paced fun of the game for me.. Totally kills the mood, although it is cool sometimes.  Could be an optional powerup or 5th button.  


..............................................................................................................................................................


CONCLUSION : 

Options are your best friend. Please dont just remove something and replace it with something else entirely.   Some poeple prefer one thing over another.  

Online play will be coming to this game later on im sure.  On a positive note the UI work is great. Always improving. The music score is also nice.

There is no problem in the gameplay , but how the game is visually presented has totally gimped it for me and made it unplayable. If you could provide me with an older build of this game, I'd much rather play that than what is on the steam store right now.   

I dont have any reviews on my account, but i care enough about this game to write this out.  Your feedback on this review would be much appreciated.  Heres hoping a dev replies or these issues are addressed.       

................................................................................................................................................................


EDIT :     CHANGES IN THE BETA VERSION OF THE GAME :   


The beta build of the game includes a lot of improvements, which are :  

1)   A bloom and rocket trail slider.  The lowest setting in bloom is still too high for me, its the same as the regular game.  The bloom slider is overkill. http://i.imgur.com/IyQAukE.gifv

2) Tug of war is back!  But if you prefer the health bubbles, you now have bubble size, rotation speed, and distance from ship.  

3) An option to enable/disable speedup/slowdown  pickups.  Though there is a bug that the pickups still appear in game, they just dont do anything. 

Other misc things  and comments :   I still find the game more difficult to play than pre christmas update. Colors are brighter? The particles? I cant pin it down for sure without playing an old build again but here are my comments :  

The pulsating rocket trail and environment objects distracts me.  Also, i still prefer the discolored rocket trails.   The speed boost sparks are something id want to turn off too.   In the tug of war end game timer, white on white is too difficult to see.  Its hard to tell how much time you have left, please change that.    



No 1980x1080 resolution in the beta build, but thats a minor gripe. 

A new gameplay feature i noticed that i DID like, is that you can now visibly see when a rocket is charging an attack. Awesome.  But instead of the white lines that indicate this, a colored outerglow or border so that its easier to see?    

Progress is going well, i look forward to it.

review:
Gioco veloce, luminoso e colorato. Ideale per gli amanti della disco anni '80, un po' meno per chi soffre di epilessia.
Se la prima impressione quando lo si avvia può essere un bel "ma che...?", una volta capito come navigare tra i menu (la scelta dei tasti di base non è proprio l'apoteosi della comodità) e come controllare il nostro razzo, può diventare davvero divertente.
Supporta fino a 4 giocatori diversi, con difficoltà crescente man mano che aumentano.
Gli unici difetti sono (per ora) la mancanza del multiplayer, che verrà aggiunto in seguito, e la scarsità di mappe, anche se come al solito, c'è sempre il workshop a risolvere il problema.
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS, dal canto suo, incentiva i suoi giocatori a usare la fantasia, a diventare loro stessi creatori di contenuti e a provare quelli degli altri (alcuni obiettivi possono essere sbloccati solo in mappe del workshop ad esempio). Che sia per pigrizia degli sviluppatori, o per rendere tutto il più dinamico, potrebbe essere un'ottima mossa.
Questo titolo sembra avere degli assi nella manica, stiamo a vedere come li giocherà.

review:
This game is pretty awesome. You fly a rocket and shoot at other rockets. It has a great soundtrack, the announcer is very well voiced, the colors used are amazing, and everything works very smoothly with few problems. However, the game is all but unplayable.

You see, the rockets all leave trails behind themselves - trails that don't dissappear. The screen quickly fills up with color, so you easily lose track of your rocket. Even worse, the rockets and all projectiles are rather small, so they would be difficult to see without color trails clogging up the screen.

I want to like this game. The gameplay seems good, the music is awesome, the game looks great - but I can't. the rockets' color trails and small projectile size make the game all but unplayable.

review:
In my view, the best indie game I've ever played so far.

It's a simple game where ROCKETS shoot several explosives at other ROCKETS.
Yet it's energetic and how the beats fit to the awesome music is just gorgeous.
I always get pumped up by playing this.

You can play alone with the AI or with friends in local multiplayer.
The AI is also pretty good and merciless. You may lose a lot in your first tries.

It's recommended to play with a controller. Your hands may hurt after playing a few rounds with the keyboard.
The game is still under development:  Full 4 player support and online mode are coming soon. (Keep in mind that online mode is not 100% comfirmed yet and may not be in the final game. But it will, most likely.)
The development is slow, but it's understandable since it's a small team.

You can also go to the "experimental" stage by selecting Betas in the Properties from the Steam Libray to jump straight into the development and test the new features before they are officialy released.

I totally recommend this game to everyone! Just give it a try.

review:
I know it's always best to wait until a product is into it's full release before judging it, but this game is just so much fun to play! There are only two modes available at the moment, but even just the regular dogfighting game mode is extremely entertaining! The controls were difficult to learn with the keyboard, unfortunately, as they aren't actually labelled anywhere. They only give you the controls for a controller, which was especially frustrating because I had to press every button on the keyboard to figure out what did what while trying to evade the AI rocket. I also can't find any way to play underdog mode or team play. I can't wait for online play, campaign, and co-op!

+Super fun and entertaining
+Very fast-paced, hectic, and frenzied
+Button mashing works!(just don't hit yourself with the bombs)
+Local competitive
+Beautiful
-UI was quite confusing when using a keyboard
-Haven't yet found a way to play underdog mode or team play
-Only two modes

Can't wait for the upcoming updates!

review:
2015年5月27日
1.游戏相对于早期，改变很大（我是2014年7月购买的）；

————————————————————————————————————
早期评测：
游戏不错，就是很多部分有待开发。目前游戏操作设置里默认的是手柄，没有写键盘。官网上有：WASD+J火箭/K雷/L炸弹，或者方向键+C火箭/X雷/Z炸弹。其中雷是可以对自身造成伤害的。（有问题欢迎指正）
游戏整体很赞，音乐很动感，飞行及射击感觉不错。可惜没有手柄，键盘实在是太累手指了。

呃，至于成就嘛，就一个，登录玩儿一下就圆满了。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342736', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1452895380}
review:
Un excellent jeu pour des duels entre potes.

On manie chacun une fusée avec 3 armes : des tirs qui partent droit (selon l'orientation de la fusée), des mines qui ressemblent plus à des grenades/missiles avec une trajectoire courbe, et des bombes uqi explosent après quelques secondes derrière nous. Et avec ça, il faut se déplacer dans le niveau, éviter les tirs adverses tout en arrivant à en placer une. Le premier qui marque 3 points d'affilée gagne.

Le jeu est diablement fun, avec ses graphismes colorés, ses effets particulièrement réussis grâce aux trainées que laissent les différents tirs et les fusées. Au final on a droit à un ballet magnifique à l'écran, et il y a une grande technicité dans les duels. RocketsRocketsRockets fait partie de ces jeux simples à prendre en main mais difficiles à maîtriser. C'est également un jeu idéal pour disputer un duel de quelques minutes entre potes, régler un differend ou tout simplement se foutre sur la gueule.

Un jeu que je recommande vivement, même en early access.

Dans cette première version, le multi a plus de 2 ne fonctionne pas, mais les joutes à 4 risquent d'être fort fun quand ça sortira.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001088727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1430620398}
review:
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS probably has the most rockets of any game on Steam. The mechanics are simple but solid. The only officially supported game mode in this early Early Access build is one-on-one against the AI, but there's plenty more planned along the way. There's also [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/289760/discussions/0/540741769648418370/]the ability to fundamentally alter the physics and mechanics via a config file[/url] to tweak how the game is played, which is pretty neat. The graphics are basic, but are beautifully stylized and suit the game well. Flying your rocket just feels [i]right[/i] which is a pretty crucial thing to nail.

I was initially drawn by the similarities to Gimbal, another top-down space shooter. That's about where the similarities end though. Gimbal has a variety of different parts and lets you build your own ships, all with a unique way of handling. ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS puts everyone on an equal playing field with only a few tools, focusing on individual skill. Gimbal is a very serious take on the genre, whereas ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is as crazy and flamboyant as its art style. Both have their appeal, but ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is infinitely easier to pick up and play, especially on the couch for local multiplayer.

It should also be noted that you should have a controller to play this game. Keyboard controls are included, but the game is designed around the analog capabilities of the thumbstick. It's also far easier to hammer on the buttons of a gamepad to fire rapidly than on your keyboard, though you can make use of the aforementioned config file to up the fire rate of your weapons when you hold down the button.

Lastly, it's important for any Early Access game to have devs that respond to user feedback and actually work on building the game rather than using the Early Access tag as an excuse to sell something that normally would be decried for being incomplete. From my observation of the devs thus far they seem trustworthy, so nothing to worry about on that front. If the concept interests you at all, I'd definitely recommend picking this game up sooner rather than later to get in on it while it's still cheap ($5 at time of writing, $1.25 if you can snag a 75% off coupon).

review:
This is going to be good.
Right now ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is a brilliant little game and well worth the £4 price, when the extra features are added this will be utterly sublime.
The flight feels similar to Luftrausers, but with ROCKETS, and is therefore instantly better.

With the current AI you can play 1V1 1V2 2V2 or 1V3, all of which are very enjoyable.
My main critism is that the AI are really good, and it would be nice to have the option to tone them down,  but only slightly.

When I first started playing the game felt hectic and utterly skillless. But after giving it a bit more time I can actually see this being a bloody marvelous competition game if two competent players were competing completely.
The scoring system is a tug of war affair, where every hit brings you closer to winning, however being hit pulls the score back from your end and closer to the enemy's victory which can result theoretically in unlimitely long battles presuming both players are decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027911295', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1574484884}
review:
Surprisingly, while most of the optional features are missing (including a working options menu, not too big of a problem at this point) the core gameplay and look of the game is quite solid.  The input could use a little more fine tuning to increase the response time and precision, but it's mostly reliable, certainly better than a lot of games.

The big problems at the moment are that the control scheme isn't explained, and while the keyboard controls are functional, they are a bit awkward (which they acknowledge).  Also, it crashes with two players and two bots (as of 5/9/14).

However, even if you don't want to get this game now (which, for 5 bucks isn't much of a risk) keep it on your radar.  The gameplay is much more nuanced than expected.  The three different weapons don't fire in a set arc for damage, they react with physics in a fashion that adds both a layer of unpredictablility and extra utility.  

For example, while you can shield a straight rocket, you can also fire more rockets at it to deflect it.  Those could then fire off in some unpredicted direction and hit another player.  Is your opponent dropping mines?  Fire a missle at the mine and bounce it in to him.  Things like that.  Straight forward, but nuanced.

A dogfight match can last anywhere between 10 seconds and 10 minutes depending on how well matched the players are, or how poorly they make decisions.  It is also quite good as a compettitive game.  Though chaotic looking, it's chaotic in the way Super Smash Bros is chaotic.  A lot is going on, but everything is based on a cause and effect system.

So if you're looking for a good local co-op game, this is one.  Online multiplayer is planned, but currently (5/9/14) unavailable.  If you prefer to play it in a more complete form, put it on your wishlist.  It is very promising, and for me, already worth a buy.

I can see this being incredibly satisfying when your skill level increases to a point where you can actually land the shots you want to to kill the enemy and not just kill them by spamming buttons :)

The color pallete is nice, very nice.

The graphics style is VERY simple, yet it works and feels like it has to be that way otherwise you really wouldnt be able to see whats happening as things happen so fast.

The music is good, but needs more tracks.

the price is good for the type of game, I think £4 is what i feel happy paying.

Cons:

Very limited gameplay atm. The only gamemode available is "Dogfight", which is just you against AI. (I am unsure if local MP is working)

maybe to difficult at times, maybe a difficulty slider would be good.


So final thought is it is a great concept, well executed for a good price. But that is only if the whole game getts fleshed out with multiplayer online, moree game modes, more music, more maps etc. As it stands now I would say buy it if you want to support the devs, but if you want a fully fleshed out game then wait a couple of months and keep checking back to see what people say, as its very light on content at this point and that will not please some people.

ROCKETS[b]ROCKETS[/b]ROCKETS. I haven't had more fun with a game in awhile, and I have a lot of games. However, I will not make this review solely based on praising the game, but to get a better idea of what the gameplay is like I will explain all the core mechanics and aspects of the game. Pictures will not help you, you must try this out for yourself.

[b]What is ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS?[/b]

[b]R3[/b] is a rocket flying arcade shooter, where you shoot rockets at other rockets. 
Currently there is one single gamemode with local only, but don't let this dissapoint you. All my hours are with its smart 1v1 AI that faces a huge challenge at first. Games can go either way everytime. R3 relies on quick twitch mechanics with its easier to learn gameplay and controls. The learning curve flows very nicely where you will be able to play decently after a couple of hours, but you will always get better. 

You have three weapons.
[b]Standard Rockets[/b](You will use this most of the time.)

[b]Drop Rockets[/b](These are advanced and even I have trouble using them. Many people accidentally hit themselves with it. It takes practice.)
- They drop using physics, so based off your momentum and gravity,
the rockets will drop different ways. Usually you want to use this when the enemy is far below you.

[b]Mine[/b](Static mine that pops out behind you.)

The neat part about R3 is its controls. They aren't relative. Up goes upward, right goes right, etc. This means you have true freedom in how you move. You can pull of neat turns and dodge obstacles at fast speeds. Hitting someone can be sometimes very difficult. 
You have a shield that you activate with a button, it only comes on for about a second and will promptly dissapear. Rockets can't get through your shield but mines can. This helps prevent your uninvitable doom when faced with a barrage of rockets that you realize you can not dodge. It also gives you a little boost, and has a cooldown, so you better be careful when using it.

The standard gamemode is an advantage system. Whoever has a +3 advantage in hits wins. 
Your opponent has 2 points and you hit them. They now have 1 point and you still have 0. When they are back at 0 you can now score. This gamemode influences long high octane battles, however if this sounds off to you still consider getting it as the developer plans to add more gamemodes.

[b]Now what about the Developer!?[/b]
The lead Developer Andy Moore is probably one of the best Early Access indie devs I've seen that not only is commited to adding lots of content, but making sure everyone has an enjoyable experience. Don't be afraid that this game will not work for you, he always puts out experimental builds that you can opt into to try and listens to every complaint you have.
He's not the type of developer that goes, "I like feedback, but I'm not going to actually use said feedback". He updates in a regular and timely manner and is always in the discussions on the forum.

So don't be afraid to put your money into this project. Infact I encourage you because the price will get higher upon release. Yes, this does seem off putting to a lot of you. However, the game is fairly polished and always recieving updates. They have plans for after release also. No, this won't end up being $60(DayZ... really?). My guess is $10 - $15.

[b]Hot Jams[/b]
The music in this game is absolutely wonderful. It's composed by Power Up Audio, who did the music for Towerfall: Ascension and many others. Check them out! It features upbeat electro space jams. You can listen to it all day. I swear. It currently only includes 4 tracks. Menu theme and two in-game themes and a 2 part win theme. All are good and mastered well. They are adding in more music, but you can tell by the quality that they put effort into it.

[b]What's not good about R3[/b]
- Currently it has a limited options menu(which will be improved soon.)
- It needs a bit more polish on the UI, it's very clean and neat however it's missing a good amount of stuff.
- The game is in Early Access so AI is only complete for 1v1, but they are now testing multi AI currently so I wouldn't worry about it. Honestly, the game is best for 1v1. You will probably most likely play 1v1. Any higher is for more advanced players. 

Alright, I can't think of anymore problems.

[b]Will this game support my controller and keyboard!?[/b]
Most likely: Yes. Literally every recent update he has added support for a bunch of random controllers I've never even heard off. Keyboard controls are good at the moment, but are always getting better. 

[b]What should I be warned about before buying?[/b]
It's Alpha mate. Things change.

[b]What I'm worried about in the Future[/b]

Multiplayer Netccode
This game features a lot of collision and player interaction which is why it must have a good netcode. Netcode is the reason I haven't purchased Brawlhalla. I do expect on Multiplayer release the netcode to be very shoddy, however I hope the developers will work very hard on it, and based on my comment on the dev,  I'm sure he will.

I hope this doesn't require any of our own servers like many indie games have been doing lately. A Peer-to-peer lobby or universal servers will be better.

[b]What I need you to do.[/b]
Buy this game. It won't be good without players. Don't hold off and get it. $5, and you're getting it at a cheaper price than release also. Hate the idea of paying developers for alpha testing? Remember when games didn't tell you they were incomplete till you bought them? You're supporting development and helping this game get out there and faster. By buying in you allow them to afford a multitude of things that will go back into the game. Servers, advertisement, features, music. Just do it.

In current development I give R3 a: [b]7/10[/b] Unique!

Gameplay and Controls: 10 Best!
Settings and UI: 5/10 Average

And I don't do that BS where 7 is average. 5 is average on my scale. 

[b]Have fun Rocketeers![/b]

[b]tl;dr[/b]
+ Well polished.
+ Frequent Updates
+ Dedicated Devloper who releases Expiremental builds to ensure all users are having fun. Have a problem? Just post in the forum, a build will be out in seconds!
+ Hot Jams
+ Great Controls and pacing
+ Support for everything
+ Learning Curve
+ Button Mashing is actually fun?

- Limited Setting(at the moment!)
- Missing a couple of in-game UI elements
- Only two modes avaliable

review:
This is certainly a very interesting and intense game. You have to use a balance of both tactics and bruit force to win, and if you think you can just spam attack, then think again, the game will punish you by your own missiles. They are very happy to blow up the first thing they touch, weather it be friend or foe. 

The tug of war like scoring mechanism makes it very easy for the tables to be turned. You can be winning one minute, and totally owned the next. 

The last chance timer forces you to fight to your death when you're on your last legs, knowing that if the timer runs out, or, if you take one more hit, you will lose.

I will have to say that this is a very well thought out and visually stunning 2D dog fighting game, and even in its early Access stage, it is well worth the £3.99, or even better; £10.99 to pick up 3 other copies for your friends, that will bring you hours of fun when the multiplayer is added.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961494531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1404171978}
review:
ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS is exactly what the title implies. You fly around in a rocket and prove to others who is the studliest of all the rockets. 

Here's a Quick Look video if you want to see how this game plays. There's also my review below if you simply want a more in-depth and concise look at the game. 

http://youtu.be/daoI-IMkVk0

Let me start my review by saying this game is extremely bare at this point. It only has local dogfighting between 2 rockets, 2 v 1 underdog mode, or team deathmatch. But damn is the dogfighting good. You get three different ways to attack: by shooting lasers that go straight ahead, dropping bombs that fling out your side and are effected by gravity, and finally mines that shoot out your backside and blow up behind you. Simple right? But try throwing that in with high-speed rocket action. Suddenly you have to plan your shots to cut off the path your enemy is flying. Did the enemy drop a mine? Knock it right back at him with a laser and laugh in his face. Wanna rain death on a pursuer? Fling bombs into the sky and try to weave away from the hail of death. It's simply fun experimenting and trying to become the best pilot. 

And trust me, you'll always know who is the better pilot. You simply can't win the game based solely on luck. You have to dominate your opponent with the tag system they implemented. Basically put, both sides start from scratch, and if you hit the enemy 3 times in a row, it's your win. But if he hits you once, he'll knock a tag off your streak that you'll have to make up for until you fill the gauge in the top of the screen. This means games can end quickly, or be an intense test of endurance between two evenly-matched pilots.

Another great point of this game is the visuals. I love painting the cosmos with my vapor trails. Not only does it enhance the sense of speed you're getting, but it also tells the tale of the dance of death the rockets have been through. And when I say dance, I mean it. The music in this game is super catchy, too.

But let's discuss some negatives now. Just keep in mind that his is Early Access, and most of this will probably get changed in future patches.

*The game is super short in its current state (you do everything there is to do once you play your first match). It's just dogfighting. And while it's good, it might not be enough to sell it at this point for some people.
*There is no progression or anything to unlock. Something that'll keep the player coming back for more is always knowing they'll get rewarded if they play more.
*All the rockets are the same, just colored differently. I'd like to have different looking rockets just for cosmetic purposes at least. Just something to make me feel unique.
*No upgrades to weapons. I'm not talking flat out upgrades that are better than another, but more of something that makes them act differently. Like a laser that fires faster but has limited range. Or a mine that explodes in a larger radius but you can't shoot out as many. Just something to make this game more strategic and diverse would be good.
*No online. This will be fixed later, but it'll remain a negative until it's implemented.
*No tutorial. Sure it's fun flying around and getting absolutely owned by the AI for the first few times, but some sort of menu to list the controls would be nice.
*No options menu. You can't change the sound effects, resolution, or anything else ingame currently.

Now while that may be a lot of negatives, most--if not all--of those while be ironed out in the future. So wait until then if they bother you.

So to wrap this up, this game is going to bud into something very good. And for the low cost of $5 they're handing it out for currently, it certainly worth picking it up even now.

*As a side note, I will (hopefully) update this review as major patches are released or just do it again once it's finally released. Just yell at me and I'll come running to take another look if I forget.*

author: {'steamid': '76561198057453796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1514173915}
review:
This game is very fun.. once you know the controls. At first I was very confused with how I controlled my rocket, thinking it was relative, but then I realized the up arrow goes up, down arrow goes down, left goes left, and right goes right. Okay, I had that figured out, but then I needed to figure out how to shoot. Space? No. Shift? No, that's a weird shield thing. Control? Nope. X? Nah. Z? Nope! D? Ah, that shoots rockets. I then started pressing WASD to see what it would do. A shoots smaller rockets, and S drops bombs. 

Also, my resolution is stuck at 800x600, for some reason. This game needs an options menu, or even just a seperate executable to change the resolution. 

For positive, well, the music is amazing!! This game is also very beautiful, and fast paced. It has a feel to it... It's great. And the light trails, wow. The AI is very smart, also. Still haven't won a battle.

Anyway, this is a great game, and has a lot of potential for future multiplayer, but I feel it needs a tutorial and some options.
Pick it up, though, it's worth it!

EDIT: It seems the developer added some settings! That's great, he even added a controls page. I'm loving the game and it fixed most of its problems!

 I know that this game will be also very good for the keyboard in the future, because right now it seems the developer still seems uncertain about the current controls. Hoping for the best! 

Again, it's a great game, worth the money, pick it up!

Hey! I am a member of TEAM ROCKETS so my review would be biased and terrible for you. But we would like to hear your feedback; we check the steam forums many times a day!

But if you want to know what I really think about ROCKETSROCKETSROCKETS, let's get *serious* for a moment.

I've been a game developer for many years. A lot of times you work on an exciting idea that seems like it might work, and a lot of times you work on things just out of momentum, and sometimes you wake up and discover you're working on something you should have cancelled months ago. It's sorta the way life goes, as a developer; it's hard to objectively see what you are working on as anything but "good." A lot of the time it's hard to even find playtesters to help you out.

Sometimes, though - rarely - an idea comes along that hits you like falling in love does. You jump out of bed every day to work on it. You can't stop thinking about it. The whole world gets more vibrant, and you see your idea everywhere. Everyone you show the early prototypes to instantly get it and also fall in love. You start gaining fans and all you have is a title screen or a doodle on a napkin... And they aren't friends or family. This kind of experience is incredibly rare, and I am stupendously honoured to be feeling it for ROCKETS right now.

I know I'm in the thick of it right now, and I still have those rose-colored glasses on, but I think I will fondly look back on ROCKETS for the rest of my life. It may not be my best technical work, it may be unfinished right now, and it may not become a commercial success (I'm writing this before the Early Access launch!), but by golly does this game feel right in every way.

It feels incredible to build, it feels incredible to play, and it feels incredible to be a part of this talented team.

I hope you'll fall in love with the game like I did.
